pronunciation: SHEK'EL, [Heb. to way; Low Latin siclus.]

definitions.text:
An ancient weight and coin among the Jews and other nations of the same stock. Dr. Arbuthnot makes the weight to have been equal to 9 pennyweights, 2 4/ 7 grains, Troy weight, and the value of 2 Samuel 3:1 3/ 8d. sterling, or about half a dollar. Others make its value 2 Sam 6d. sterling. The golden shekel was worht
1.
16.
6. pounds sterling, about $ 8,
12.
